description: CONTINUED USE OF SITE AS A HAND CAR WASH BUSINESS
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 600200 Rev A, 600300 Rev A and 600301 Rev A.

Condition : 3 - Vehicles shall access and exit the site from Burlington Road in a forward gear only. No vehicles associated with the use as a hand car wash business shall reverse out onto Burlington Road.

Condition : 4 - The use of powered equipment, such as pressure washers and vacuum cleaners, shall not be permitted outside of the building at any time without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 5 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers except between the hours of 08.00 - 18.30 (Monday to Saturday) and 10.00 - 17.00 (Sundays and Bank Holidays).

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
Car wash liquid is classed as trade effluent. No vehicle wash waters, steam cleaning effluent, or pressure wash effluent, should be discharged to the surface water system. Run-off should be discharged to the foul sewer network if available subject to the approval of your sewerage company.
If you are not able to discharge the effluent to the foul sewer it can be collected and removed to an authorised disposal site. In this instance the effluent will be classed as waste and you must comply with your duty of care responsibilities. Alternatively the effluent can be collected and directed to an on-site treatment system. Please refer to the Environment Agency's pollution prevention guidance (PPG), particularly PPG13 on vehicle washing and cleaning.

Condition : 7 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant was offered the opportunity to submit additional information in order to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms.
